titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of W. D. (William De Witt) Snodgrass, 1984-2013, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Mary McSparran

change.item: Encoded finding aid updated, added arrangement, container list, and completed full finding aid.

did.abstract: The Snodgrass, W. D. mss., 1984-2013, consists of the original and photocopied correspondence, emails, obituaries, and tributes concerning the illness and death of W. D. Snodgrass, 1926-2009. Most correspondence and emails are between Snodgrass's friends and colleagues and his fourth wife, writer Kathleen Snodgrass.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: W. D. Snodgrass was born in Wilkinsburg, Pennsylvania, on January 5, 1926. He studied at Geneva College before serving in the United States Navy during World War II. After leaving the Navy, Snodgrass finished his BA (1949) at the University of Iowa, where he also completed an MA in English (1951) and an MFA in Creative Writing (1953). Snodgrass won the Pulitzer Prize for his debut poetry collection, Heart's Needle, in 1960. He published a total of nineteen poetry collections as well as several anthologies and works of literary criticism. Snodgrass married his fourth wife, translator Kathleen Brown, 1950-, in 1985. He died in Erieville, New York, on January 13, 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains original and photocopied correspondence, emails, obituaries, and tributes concerning William De Witt Snodgrass's (1926-2009) illness and death. Most correspondence and emails are between Snodgrass's friends and colleagues and his fourth wife, writer Kathleen Snodgrass.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged at the file level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Snodgrass, W. D. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See Snodgrass/Segal mss., and Sillitoe mss., also located at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

scopecontent.p: Folder contains originals of poems, various poets and dates.
